alert.note: Alert for Coastal Palm Beach County; Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Broward and southeastern Palm Beach Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Boynton Beach, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Margate, Lake Worth, Lighthouse Point, Palm Beach, Highland Beach, Ocean Ridge, Coconut Creek, Greenacres, Parkland, Lantana, Atlantis, Hillsboro Beach, Mission Bay and Boca Pointe. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.
